article:
'Polonium' is a chemical element with the symbol 'Po' and atomic number 84,
discovered in 1898 by Maria SkÅodowska-Curie and Pierre Curie. A rare and highly
radioactive element with no stable isotopes, polonium is chemically similar to
bismuth and tellurium, and it occurs in uranium ores. Applications of polonium
are few, and include heaters in space probes, antistatic devices, and sources of
neutrons and alpha particles. Because of its position in the periodic table,
polonium is sometimes classified as a metalloid. However, other
sources say that on the basis of its properties and behavior, it is
"unambiguously a metal".
